Middle River Park, Waterview Avenue Shoreline, Public paths, piers, boat launch, Baltimore Rowing Club and Water Resources Center, 1985/86



-



*

uture Opportunities ‘

The Middle Branch Park Plan and the
Waterview Avenue Industrial Park Plan
have laid the basis for a number of signifi-
cant future public and private development
opportunities. Many of these are part of a
long-range improvement plan and include:

*Reedbird Park Improvements - As
funds become available, ballfields,
landscaping, bikeways and pedestrian
paths, boating facilities, and other
recreational uses will be added to the
park. Plans call for completion of the
pathway from the play area at Hanover
Street to run along the shoreline and
connect into Baltimore County’s park
and the Patapsco Valley State Park.
There is also the possibility of operat-

ing a boat-rental facility in the
enclosed portion of the river between
Hanover Street Bridge and the B& O
Railroad bridge. Extensive landscaping
for both the east and west portions of
the park is planned. Proposals will also
be developed for using the large hill in
the park for a variety of active recrea-
tional uses.

69

*Waterview Park - A master plan has

been prepared and accepted by the
City for the shoreline area north of
Waterview Avenue. The first phase of
the plan is now underway. The City
has acquired approximately 8.7 acres
adjacent to a City-owned parcel of
about 1.7 acres, totalling 10.4 acres for
park development. The acquisition and
relocation of several junkyards in the
area was-completed by the summer of

11983. All acquired properties will be

graded, seeded and landscaped in
preparation for the second phase of
development. Phase two will include
shoreline stablilization, a multi-purpose
field, wetlands, and public shoreline
access piers at the west end of the
park. The master plan calls for boating
and fishing piers, picnicking and park-
ing facilities, expansion of the existing
boat launching ramp, a shoreline walk
and extesive landscaping to be devel-
oped at the east end of the park (near
the Hanover Street Bridge).

*Pier and Scenic Overlook - With the

new Waterview Avenue interchange at
Hanover and Potee Streets completed,
the old shoreline segment of Water-
view Avenue could be partially
removed and used for parking for a
scenic overlook as well as for a pier
that could be developed at the site.
This area could also be connected to
other sections of the park by a
pathway.
